techmeme.title: Sources: Apple is plotting its AI comeback with robots, a lifelike version of Siri, a smart speaker with a display, and home security cameras (Mark Gurman/Bloomberg)
Bullish shares jump 143% to $90 in the company's NYSE debut, up from the IPO price of $37; sources say the IPO was more than 20 times oversubscribed (Bloomberg)
Google is rolling out a feature for Gemini that, when enabled, will let the AI chatbot "remember" a user's past conversations without prompting (Emma Roth/The Verge)
Chinese chip equipment supplier E-Town sues Applied Materials in the Beijing IP Court over alleged trade secret theft; Applied Materials hired two E-Town staff (Bloomberg)
A look at social media "clippers", who are paid $0.50 to $2 per thousand views by streamers, podcasts, and startups to make buzzy moments go viral online (Ben Raab/Wall Street Journal)
